message.content:
cs.AR, cs.DC, cs.SE, cs.SY, cs.ET

Reasoning: 
- cs.AR (Architecture): The paper proposes a novel design methodology to explore the architectural-space of heterogeneous reliability modes for out-of-order superscalar multi-core processors. 
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): The paper discusses the use of Distributed Multi-threaded Checkpointing (DMTCP) and Hash-based Incremental Checkpointing (HBICT) to enhance the design space of heterogeneous reliability modes. 
- cs.SE (Software Engineering): The paper discusses the use of different processor state compression techniques like GNU zip to reduce checkpoint sizes. 
- cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper proposes a methodology to choose an optimal configuration at run time to meet the reliability requirements of a given system while reducing the corresponding power overheads. 
- cs.ET (Emerging Technologies): The paper discusses the use of novel techniques to explore the design space of heterogeneous reliability modes and enhance the effectiveness of checkpointing.
